I guess they're getting tired of winning.

text: Maxine waters is an absolute disgrace. My Chickasaw mother grew up in abject poverty in a one room dirt floor shanty that makes Chicago ghettos look like luxury; she went to work full time when she was 13 to put herself through high school, then worked her butt off to put herself through college. At the end of the day my mother shattered glass ceilings, and retired at the top of her field as a pioneer in the field of occupational nursing, having ran the medical departments for Oregon's giants in industry. According to Waters my mother was an "educated idiot" because she said the exact same thing Carson, who also overcame poverty, has stated. Waters and her liberal kind absolutely disgust and sicken me.
label: toxic

text:
There are no major religious denominations or churches that teach that.  To mischaracterize the Catholic teaching in that way is absurd.  That is not religious hypocracy (behaving against your own beliefs when it suits you) because that is not what any religious people believe.  I'd check the other 1,567,865,678,566,000 instances to see if those are in your imagination, also.  

In a nutshell, Catholic teaching is that when you have sex it should be with the person you are sacramentally united to in marriage and you should be open to children.  You cannot try to stop the sexual act from being procreative, but you are certainly allowed to enjoy sex that is not procreative, even if you know it is likely it will be naturally not procreative.  There is a huge body of explanation on this called the theology of the body, but the reasoning boils not to life issues, but to human dignity and love.

text: The bigger issue here is the issue of what a homeless person is.  There is homeless by life problems, the real homeless.  And there is homeless by choice, the low-life, scammer homeless.  The real homeless are a real problem.  But lots of folks come to Anchorage in the summer because it is a free ticket to a party life.  Get money from panhandling and stealing stuff, free food from Brother Francis, party in the woods with your friends.  Such types are easy to identify on the street corner.  They are the ones that drop the "Anything Helps, God Bless" sign to read a text message on their smartphone.  Support in Anchorage for "homelessness" needs to be better focused.  Supporting anyone that claims homelessness only creates more homelessness.  And don't give money to panhandlers (especially the ones wearing iPhone ear buds), because you are likely getting scammed.
label: not toxic

text: Overall I agree with Manning. I have some articles with point one which embraces Manning/conservative ideology which is not at the core of what pushes populism from merely a conservative thing to a broader group. While I can't stand Wynne, this is an unnecessary partisan shot. I agree with point 2 and Trudeau is extremely guilty of this and the leader of this type of blather in Canada, still, part of the problem is that it is not limited to Trudeau, Liberals or NDP. I am completely inside with point 3. Point 4 is silly and a bit of a reach in terms of relevance. Finally, I would replace words like restore with encourage and respect as the path to getting restoration.
label: not toxic
